title: ConfigMappings with single List of objects can't be processed
body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus will not correctly import configuration data from an application.yaml.

I tested the usage of yaml configuration files with Quarkus 3.8.2 based on the source code in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/config-quickstart and https://quarkus.io/guides/config-yaml.
I am using the following application.yaml:
``` 
greeting:
  message: Hallo
  name: JÃ¶rg
country:
  - codes:
      - "cn"
      - "cn_vg"
    types:
      - CAR
  - codes:
      - "ab"
      - "cd"
    types:
      - MOTORCYCLE
```
I am using a @ConfigMapping(prefix="country").

### Expected behavior

I would expect Quarkus to process the configuration and place the list below the "country" key into a Java List of interface type CountryConfiguration (which I will provide).

### Actual behavior

If I run the program, the Quarkus application cannot be started and emits an error message that the configuration in the application.yaml has no root. The symptoms are the same as in https://github.com/smallrye/smallrye-config/issues/517

### How to Reproduce?

Please see the bug description above

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

I also posted the bug in the quarkus quickstarts repo :  https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/issues/1396
